title: Danielle Lloyd lashes out at ex Jamie O'Hara again in explosive new tweets, after he denies domestic violence allegations
text:
Danielle Lloyd lashes out at ex Jamie O'Hara again in explosive new tweets, after he denies domestic violence allegations The couple's very public rowing continued with more explosive allegations from Danielle - which Jamie vehemently denies Share By Lara Martin 14:32, 26 FEB 2017 Celebs (Photo: Rex/FameFlynet) Share Get celebs Danielle Lloyd and Jamie O’Hara ’s war of words has taken another bitter twist today, as the exes continued to lash out at each other on social media.
The former couple have already exchanged words after Danielle posted explosive tweets accusing Jamie of domestic violence and he responded by branding her claims “lies” and suggesting he’d take legal action.
And on Sunday, the mud-slinging continued between the ex spouses, who are parents to three young sons: Harry, Archie and George.
Danielle and Jamie were once married (Photo: Getty) Danielle and Jamie's split has become bitter Read More Danielle Lloyd hits back at Jamie O'Hara after he claimed she's REFUSING to let him see their children It started when Jamie, 33, took to Twitter to insist he’d “never” lay his hands on a woman, and posted Quote: s from a 2014 interview that Danielle did with OK! magazine in which she backed that claim up.
He tweeted: “Quote: s from danielle. will not tolerate these lies and have my name slandered by someone who is obviously not well, would never touch a women (sic)."
In the interview, Danielle spoke about claims she’d had a bust up with Jamie in Las Vegas, saying that wasn’t true and adding: “The worst part was that people made out Jamie and I were arguing and that he’d hit me, but Jamie would never hit me, he’d be too scared of me hitting him back."
Danielle, who is now engaged to electrician Michael O’Neill, then fired back with a tweet of her own, saying: “You abused me in front of the kids last year and then when my fella came out u ran off and phoned the police on him cus u got scared (sic).”
She then posted screenshots of an email that appeared to be from Jamie, sent in 2016, in which Jamie asked to “bury the hatchet” with her and expressed regret for past actions.
Danielle continued to tweet: “Am finally speaking out and standing up for myself and other abused women! Abuse is not just physical but mental I've been through both.”
When a fellow Twitter user asked why she didn’t address the situation out of the public eye, Danielle replied: “I've tried and he has continued to wear me down and write lies about me someone can only take so much.”
Danielle also accused Jamie of “making [her] lie” about what happened in Las Vegas for the sake of his career.
She shared a screenshot of a legal document which she claimed to be part of a non-molestation order against Jamie, saying: “Jamie I do not lie this is part of the non molestation order against u! You made me lie about Vegas to protect ur career.”
Danielle pictured in 2016 (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Read More Jamie O'Hara heartbroken after Danielle Lloyd REFUSES to let him see their children In the document, she alleges: “I am extremely frightened of Jamie. He is a very unpredictable character and has a terrible temper.”
She also laughed off a statement from Jamie’s rep saying he would take legal action against her allegations.
“Is this a joke legal action,” she tweeted. “Id love to see you try and sue me for telling the truth it's all recorded with police & social services (sic).”
Jamie responded to Danielle's tweets by posting a typed statement to Twitter with the message: "This is now in the hands of my lawyer as these are lies that are solely out to ruin someone's life."
His statement read: "For the avoidance of any doubt, if I had ever been violent or abusive towards Danielle I would not have full access to my children that I have. I’ve never been arrested for domestic violence and to even mention something like this is extremely upsetting to all the women that actually have to deal with these issues ion a daily basis and I find it very traumatising to even have to explain myself regards this situation. This is now in the hands of my lawyer."
Jamie has denied Danielle's allegations (Photo: Rex Features) Read More Danielle Lloyd reveals she won't be friends with Jamie O'Hara ever again Mirror Celeb has contacted Jamie’s rep for comment.
The pair’s very public war of words began yesterday when Jamie addressed custody of their three young sons, after Danielle posted a photo from a spa day with her fiancé.
“How’s this fair? I get denied access then see on social media that my children ain’t even with the mum, she’s at a spa weekend #standup [sic],” wrote the former Fulham star.
Clearly unimpressed with the comment, Danielle accused him of domestic abuse; alleging that he beat her “with a shoe” during a trip to Las Vegas, and that their son Archie has had to intervene in situations before.
She tweeted : “Jamie o'hara I battered me in Vegas with a shoe in front of Jodie and strangled me in front of ur dad and Archie [sic]."

Angela Hartnett dangles hair over and puts 0:50 Trailer for the last ever episode of Only Fools a 0:21 Fans of The Chase swoon over teenage contestant… 0:43 Jodie Marsh launches astonishing Twitter tirade i 1:01 Video will play in Danielle reveals when she found out Jamie was going on CBB She Quote: : "U have domestic violence on ur record and there has been injunctions to stop U coming near me [sic]."
As the row escalated, Danielle also began to respond to her followers, writing to one user: "The boys already know they have witnessed his violence towards me and even Archie has to drag him off me! That's emabarrassing [sic],"
Jamie responded to Danielle's claims yesterday by posting a picture of a typed statement.
It read: "I will not have my name slandered in this way - my lawyer is dealing with this and I'm not adding fuel to the fire on social media. Jeez next you will be saying I'm a drug dealer danielle like [sic]."
He captioned the image with the words: "These lies and disgraceful things being said I cannot react too, I only ever want to fight for access to my children because I love them [sic]."
